intro: Voanioala gerardii, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by small, red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
